title: PhD, Visuomotor Neuroscience
description_1: Thesis: The effects of eye movements on postural control.
description_2: Supervisors: Drs. Theodoros M. Bampouras & Susan Dewhurst, Prof. Tim Donovan.
description_3: Disseminated results in 3 scientific papers (first-author), see "Publications", several conferences, see "Conference Proceedings", and the local news.
description_4: Won Research Project of the Year award at host institution.

title: BSc, Sports and Exercise Science (First-Class Hons)
description_2: Completed and published outcome of NHS Service Evaluation, received runner-up poster prize at NHS Research and Innovation Showcase.

title: Product Specialist
description_1: Software development: Artificial pupil detector, IMU fusion algorithm, Network API tutorials (e.g. network/device synchronisation), customer support (e.g. code snippets).
description_2: Writing: Online documentation and tutorials, research digest blog.
description_3: Product training, tailored research support, sales and product demonstrations.

title: Post-doctoral Research Fellow
description_1: Project: Looking in the right places to prevent stair falls in older adults, supervised by Prof. Mark A. Hollands.
description_2: Collected and analysed movement and perception of older adults negotiating stairs to study the links between visual sampling, fear of falling, and biomechanical indicators of falls risk.
description_3: Completed battery of cognitive and physiological assessments to classify higher and lower-ability groups.
description_4: Leveraged cutting-edge eye tracking and motion capture, regularly implemented Python and R.

title: Sessional Lecturer: _Digital Technologies_ (MED.115, level 4)
description_1: Organised and delivered online module sessions and formative assessments for 29 students

title: Teaching Support Officer: _Cognition, Motor Control, 2D & 3D Motion Capture_ (levels 4--6)
description_1: Organised and delivered practical seminars incorporating demonstrations, problem-based learning and informal assessments/feedback to groups of 6--40 students.
description_2: Module content developed in collaboration with senior staff members, used relevant pedagogical literature, ensuring learning outcomes were met for curriculum.

title: Guest Lecturer: _Biomechanics Research_ (level 5)
description_1: Delivery of a yearly guest lecture on wider Biomechanics research, drawing on own scholarly work to deliver research-led teaching and learning.

title: PhD Co-supervisor
description_1: Co-supervision of a PhD student in the laboratory of Dr Richard Foster

title: Mentor/Supervisor
description_1: Trained several junior team members in laboratory techniques (e.g. eye tracking, motion capture, hardware synchronisation) to ensure competence.

title: Teaching Support Officer: (level 6)
description_1: Supervised final year project data collection in visuomotor control.
description_2: Trained placement students in groups of 3--6 how to evaluate methods of assessing visual perception.

title: Hourly Paid Academic: _Advanced Research Methods_ (level 6)
description_1: Organised and delivered content in qualitative and quantitative research methods, including study design and statistical analysis, to approx. 30 students.
description_2: Marked final year formative written assessments and poster presentations.

title: Visiting Researcher
Dunhill Medical Trust: PI  _Suitable Living Environments_
description_1: Using body worn sensors to inform data-driven home modifications with the aim of reducing falls risk in older adults
